Parliamentary Privilege Act 1885

An Act to amend the Parliamentary Privilege Act 1858
[Royal Assent 5 December 1885]

Be it enacted by His Excellency the Governor of Tasmania, by and with the advice and consent of the Legislative Council and House of Assembly, in Parliament assembled, as follows:

1. Short title
    This Act may be cited as the Parliamentary Privilege Act 1885 .

2. Power to bring prisoners before House or committee to give evidence
    Each House of Parliament is hereby empowered to order the Controller of Prisons or any gaoler to cause any person under imprisonment for any cause to be brought up before the House or any committee of such House duly authorized by the House to send for persons and papers, in order to his being examined as a witness in any matter depending before such House or committee; and after his evidence has been given, such Controller of Prisons or gaoler shall cause such prisoner to be removed and again imprisoned.

3. Order to Controller of Prisons or gaoler to be notified by summons
    Any such order to the Controller of Prisons or any gaoler under section two shall be notified to such Controller of Prisons or gaoler by a summons under the hand of the President or Speaker, as the case may be; and in any such summons shall be stated the name of the prisoner required to attend, and the time and place when and where such prisoner is to attend; and such summons shall be served on such Controller of Prisons or gaoler, either personally or by leaving the same with some person for him at his office.

4. Controller of Prisons and gaoler liable for disobedience
    The Controller of Prisons or any gaoler guilty of disobedience of any such order hereinbefore mentioned shall be liable to be punished in a summary manner, as for contempt, in the mode prescribed in the Principal Act , for the offences enumerated in section three thereof.
